title: Enhancing Medical Practical Skills: Innovative Problem-Solving Through Design Failure Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic design thinking processes and problem-definition capabilities
context.additional_context: Practical competency enhancement program for medical/nursing field practitioners

learning_goals: Within four weeks, learners can analyze three or more failure cases from the design project process and derive improvement strategies.
Learners can present project outcomes where they attempted new approaches at least twice by cultivating a mindset unafraid of failure.
Learners can write a one-page reflective journal on insights gained from failure experiences through peer feedback.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
